number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												Ah, Aliens versus Predator, probably one of my favourite crossover universes ever created. While I’m not much of a comic fan, the games worked for me pretty well so far, with AvP2 especially well done in my opinion. The first one from Rebellion was pretty good in its time and the gameplay still holds up pretty well, so I decided that it’s time to give the second game from them a spin.For starters – the story seems completely unimportant here. It merely sets the stage for the three species (humans, xenomorphs and yautja) to murder each other in a number of gory and spectacular ways. This is quite similar to the previous Rebellion-made game, and also quite different from the second outing from Monolith. While there is a plot here, with frequent dialogue and audio logs to flesh it out a bit, it never feels important one bit. Cross-species combat is the meat here, and the game does not try to hide it.And fighting, while not without its flaws, generally feels good. Marine represents your standard FPS experience, with an assortment of various guns and a dislike for close quarter combat. Weapons feel good, though some of them lack the “touch” – you never feel you are hitting your target with them until it actually falls to the ground. Xenomorph is a bit trickier, relying solely on melee combat, stealth and gravity-independent navigation to hunt its prey. It is easy to die as an alien, and it forces quite different approach than the other two races. It is also worth noting that vent mechanics, requiring you to manually enter and exit them instead of doing so automatically can be frustrating at times. Finally, the Predator is a mixture of above two, with ranged and melee weaponry at his disposal. He’s quite fragile, which requires utilisation of his distraction abilities, cloaking and vertical movement – I must say that the snappy jumping mechanic quickly became second nature to me and I enjoy it a lot.The game’s design is nothing special – environments are diverse enough, but there is nothing to gasp at here. The same areas are used with slight modifications in each campaign, but I didn’t get the feeling of repeating same thing over again. It’s all built very similarly to previous Rebellion game and I think it works pretty well in a game like this. All missions are very linear though, with few areas that allow different approaches.I am, as is usual in my reviews, not going to talk about multiplayer, simply because I never played it and was never interested in it. Now, so long after the games release I doubt there would be any populated servers, but if the mood strikes me and I have time to spare, I’ll update this review with online play impressions. So keep in mind that for the time being, this is a singleplayer-only review.Visually AvP is OK, with Direct3D 11 effects adding a little bit of flair into otherwise correctly looking game (the standard D3D9 mode does not look much worse though and might be a better choice for slower systems). Texturework is nice throughout, and characters are nicely detailed, but there is occasionally a jarring drop in geometric complexity. Vegetation is very simple while vision effects for Predator are interesting and replicate what we’ve seen in the movie quite well. Audio it OK too, with a couple of oddly sounding weapons and unmemorable background music.Overall, Aliens versus Predator 2010 is an correct game, much like the previous from the same studio. It offers solid human vs xenomorph vs predator combat experience and nothing above that. Some floaty shooting and melee mechanics prevent it from shining in that aspect, though, but unless you can hunt down a physical copy of AvP2, this is the game of choice for the fans of the franchise.

												An incredibly easy game to get into, and it sure is fun! Multiplayer especially. You choose from alien, predator, or colonial marine and fight it out with other aliens, predators, or marines. It also includes modes like Infestation, which is like Infection. One person is chosen as an alien and whenever the alien kills another player, they too become an alien and fight to turn everyone to aliens. Singleplayer is a little short, but consists of three completely different campaigns, one for each species. Marine and Predator each have 8 missions, while Alien has 6. Which is disappointing because in my opinion, Alien is my favorite species. I would definetely recommend buying this game!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 6, 2014
												Aliens vs. Predator (2010) is a re-imagining of the '99 title of the same name. The game is focused on combining the Alien and Predator franchises in the same universe and having three seperate story lines, one for each of the races and for the Colonial Marines. The main selling point of the game is that each of the three races play totally differently. Only shared factor between the gameplay is the first person perspective and thus creates a nice amount of variety.The Colonial Marines are your most basic race, the gameplay is similar to most other FPS games, you go around shooting hordes of Aliens and progress through the levels by doing different kinds of tasks. The gunplay is reasonable but not exceptional, it's nothing special and can't hold a candle to titles like F.E.A.R. but get's the job done fairly well.Xenomorphs, (Aliens, if you're a noob.) are a beastlike species that can climb walls, move at extreme speed and use their claws, teeth, and tail to quickly incapacitate their enemies. The downside is that the Xenos are completely missing any ranged attacks, meaning you're required to take a more stealthy approach to the game as you would by playing the other two races.Playing as a Predator lets you access a wide variety of different gadgets and advanced alien weaponry like the shoulder plasma cannon, thermal vision, optical camo and so on. Predators are extremely tough creatures and are the most powerful of the bunch, they don't have all that many weaknesses, but can still be defeated with a large enough group.The game borrows music from the movies and has some soundtrack of it's own as well, it's pretty enjoyable to listen and fits the atmosphere very well. Especially if you're a fan of the films, then you'll get a nice nostalgia trip as well.When AVP was released in 2010 it was one of the most demanding games by the time, (Along with Metro 2033) and looks still very good. The title was one of the pioneering DX11 games out there and supports tesselation and other basic DX11 effects as well. If you can stand some rather dated animations then you'll be fine, the textures are still better looking than in most games.AVP also supports horde based survival coop against the Aliens, and few competetive multiplayer modes. The coop is easily the strong point of the game and is very fun to play with a bunch of friends. Competetive gameplay is most likely quite dead by the time of writing but can also be played if you happen to have enough friends for it.In the end, if you're an Alien/Predator fan you already own the game. If you've just discovered the series and want to experience the older titles then look no further. This game is a very enjoyable ride that will take you around 13 hours to finish in single player, after which you still have the competetive and coop multiplayer to play.

												If you have any interest in the alien vs predator series, ever wanted to feel what its like being in the shoes of the characters or simply just wanted to be an invisible badass with thermal vision, then this is the gamne for you. Alien vs predator does the job of placing you in the shoes of either alien, marine or predator, in a way I couldnt have imagined. From the nauseating speed and manouverability of the alien, the overuling sense of superiority as the unseen predator or the fear striken, weapon toting marine. This game has it all and the campaigns each left my completley fulfilled. Disapointing though was the lack of dedicated servers which caused me to lose my interest in the multiplayer of the game which, if you were patient enough to enter, was extremley entertaining and challenging. I do believethey plan to add dedicated servers tho in the enar future!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 21, 2015
												I bought the game for a 'Predator' experience (IDGAF about the Xenos or Marines) and I wasn't disappointed. AvP 2010 is the definitive 'Predator' game (So far). The nailed the feeling of playing an omnipotent hunter stalking unwary Marines from aboveThanks to some excellent, innovative mechanics (The assisted jump springs to mind...it should be a standard feature of any Predator game in the future) and level design, hunting humans is extremely satisfying.What makes it work:- Using the predator's iconic voice mimicry to distract and lure humans to where you want- Jumping to great heights and lengths with extreme precision - this makes tree-top navigation fun and fluid- Target an Alien or a Human for a quick dash strike - this opens them up for a brutal finisher and makes melee feel precise and fluid- Predator's gadgetry....Chuck a proxy mine, lure in a Marine towards the mine....it never gets old- Level design that has a lot of verticality and room to move around in- AI which is *just* dumb enough to keep things fun but smart enough to kill you if you slip upThe options above really let you live out your Predator fantasy. You jump from vantage point to vantage point, lure in your prey, rip skulls and gouge out spines, dash in for a kill and then vanish...reappear again to seperate a spine or two from Marine bodies.It is gory, brutal and fun.The Predator levels give you tactical freedom. The mechanics empower you to BE the Predator. This game is to the Predator what the Arkham games are to the Batman - they let you embody the respective characters.If you like predatory stealth action games like Arkham Asylum/City, Splinter Cell Conviction/Blacklist, Crysis 2/3, Far Cry3/4 where you're stalking unwitting and unwary prey...picking them off one by one....laughing manically as they panic and fret over their rapidly dwindling numbers...then buy Aliens vs Predator 2010.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 23, 2015
												I went into this game a little iffy, but over all i found the experience to be extremely satisfying. It is essentially 3 games in one and lets you experience the same two or three days as a human marine, a predator or an alien. Without spoiling what happens, what is most interesting is that the storyline assumes you (the player) are playing each faction at once and therefore all factions kind of win. Within context of the story, you'll understand and it makes perfect sense. But lets break down the 3 games you get:Marine: Storywise this is the most rich and fulfilling of all three factions. You learned the most about what is happening and why. Gameplay-wise it is a bit clunky. As a "shooter" it does very few things right but accomplishes well enough for you to get along. Controls all need to be remapped but still remain clunky. Weapons seem to lack "umph" where you'd expect it. And movement... ugh, its bad. Livable, but bad. Alien: There isn't much of a story here.. i mean there is a little but it is minimal. Oddly, where the Marine experience went foul (movement) the Alien play-through does remarkably well. You can crawl and jump on all surfaces and combat feels very fluid, if not a little tough to get used to. Hunting humans is an absurd amount of fun in this mode and when you need to hunt a predator you notice a stark difference in how powerful you are. Hint: you aren't.Predator: Storyline here is really intriguing...but too short, i feel like. This is mainly due to the fact that we know literally nothing about this faction from any of the movies. As such you're left hungering for it if you like the franchise. Sadly this title doesn't answer many questions but the story is really good. Gameplay is by far my favorite. The predator is tanky, stealthy and hunts both the humans and aliens extremely effectively. My only complain is there isn't enough of it. Overall there is maybe too much gametime dedicated to the Humans compared to the Alien and Hunter factions. Realistically, you're only playing this to play as one of these two since there are a billion marine shooter games out there. That experience is really only worthy of a really well made cutscene to get all that juicy storyline in. Although its playable, you won't have nearly as much fun as playing as predator or aliens. I recommend saving the marine for last since you'll actually want the full story by the time you finish the other play-throughs. That desire will help you through any clunkiness in the gameplay. Over all a great game. The 3 factions concept is well executed and feels really nice. You leave the game really understanding what was happening on this rogue planet. You may not understand the backstory of any faction, but you know why everything is happening in this small colony and that is something rare in games or literature. It is a very fulfilling experience.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 25, 2015
												This is a review only for the campaign. The three parts of the campaign featuring marine, alien and predator as protagonists feel pretty different from each other in playstyle, which is really nice. As the marine, while you are afraid of the aliens and predators, you don't necessarily feel helpless (which I like) and you rip them all with your guns, given enough time and shots. It is somewhat generic in gameplay, but enjoyable nonetheless. Playing as the alien is mostly a stealth affair where you attract the marines with your hiss and kill them viciously with your jaws. It is I think the easiest campaign, because of the regenrating health of the alien and the fact that you stay hidden most of the time in tunnels and have excellent capability of clinging to most surfaces in any orientation.The predator campaign starts as somewhat quirky becaue you are mostly limited to melee options as your weapons need to be charged from energy sources and deplete pretty quickly, but once you get the last 2 weapons, you are a powerhouse. You get the thermal vison for humanoid enemies and alien vision for the aliens. The best part about playing as alien is again the viciousness with which you kill the humans (such as yanking their heads out) as well the utter helplessness of an alien once you hold it in your hands (after knocking it down).I took about 12 hours to complete all the campaigns on Hard difficulty, which is a decent amount of time. Considering that the game is often available for $3.75 on steam during sales, there no reason why you shouldn't buy it unless you don't like shooter games.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 4, 2014
												If you're a fan of the original AvP and AvP2 on the Monolith Engine, then you will love this remake. The game sports the same episodic style based on the three races, telling the same story but from different perspectives. This is what made the original AvP2 such a good game, and it works quite well for this game. The game controls much like the original, but with many improvements, and the graphics hold up quite well even by today's standards (its a 2010 game and we're in 2014, but a lot has change in video game graphics in 4 years).If there's one complaint, its that the Alien and Predator missions seem shorter than the Marine missions. This was a problem with the original games also. The other is the lack of more multiplayer modes and maps which allows players to really take advantage of the strengths and weaknesses of the different races. Not a lot of people play the multiplayer in this game anymore and that's a shame because the modes that do exist are still pretty good. The maps are limited but they're still good. Stalking prey as a predator is a feeling like no other, and dropping down on an unsuspecting maine as the alien is pretty awesome. The multiplayer of this game needs a revival.Overall, I'd recommend this to anyone who was a fan of the movies and especially a fan of the original Monolith Engine games. Buying this game is definitely a good investment, especially when its on sale, but the lack of active games in multiplayer may turn a lot of people off. If you guy this game, you'll be getting it most for its single-player experience which is good, but the story isn't exactly the best. Neither was the story of the original, so what can I say.

												This is a great game to play. Sometimes the campaign missions can get a little long but fun at every moment. The Marine Campaign is great from start to end. The health bar doesn't get drained just like that. So it's actually giving you a chance to survive. The only drawback I have for the marine campaign is it's number of weapons. But the smartgun is fun just to tear through aliens making you feel like a bada**. The Predator Campaign now is more focused on stealth but it doesn't have to be that way. You can tear through marines and aliens easily. There is four special weapons (hint: the last one is really strong and can help you in a tough situtation). Now the Aliens Campaign is my favorite campaign of all three. You get to feel like a true killing machine, tearing  through marines. The only drawback for the aliens campaign is you fight Predators at the end (SPOILER ALERT!). But all in all, Rebellion did an excellent job for this game with also including mutliplayer. 15/10 highly recommended.

Posted: February 11, 2015
												I have not played this game in some time mostly because I have moved on to other games but not because I thought this game was in anyway bad.I am writing a review now even though I have had the game a few years mainly because of its recent return for sale on Steam and that it seems to be getting negative reviews alongside Alien: Colonial Marine and questions as to why it was removed from sale.Having owned and unfortunatly now lost the first AvP game, I was really looking forward to this newer DX11 boasting game and true to form I was not disapointed. Graphically intense and baring in mind this came out as DX11 games were still fairly new, the effects really stood out.This version however imo is far more graphic and scarey compared to the original and it feels more true to the movies then previous attempts. There are small flaws but not game ending flaws and to be honest they were not really worth mentioning in this review.Like the previous version you have three storylines to choose from: Marine, Alien and Predator, and each has its own storyline which like AvP2 has certain crossover points which make the story more interesting.I have never been a fan of the alien storyline in all version of the game but found immense enjoyment with the Predator and Marine.I would recommend this game to anyone.As a final note, I never played this game on multiplayer, but I have become aware that this is no longer active for what ever reason. I would not be put off by this as the single player element has more than enough content for you to cover.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 21, 2015
												Very pretty and visceral, but lacking that oldschool vibe. This basically means a lot of handdholding and HUD data coupled with regenerating HP bars, following waypoints without having alternate routes/tactics available. Follow the minimap and kill the enemies, rinse repeat. I'll give a rundown of each race, as they are NOT all equally fun. Predator missions are the most fun, as all the HUD data and overpowered toys hold true to their role in the franchise. They also have the durability to do the "special" moves without dying. (Go ahead and shoot me, I'll just take my time tearing out this spine and admiring its shape as I don't give a damn about your bullets- I'll get to you in a while, mr. mcshootyguns) My only real gripe about predators is their tiny power supply- shoot your shoulder cannon 3 times and you are DRY. Marine missions just lack the fear factor of other AVP games- this marine knocks aliens on their butts like little children. The regenerating HP bars make acid blood a joke, and NOTHING can one-hit you, not a predator, not queens, nada. Medkits are so plentiful you could build a bridge out of them. Alien missions are also sort of 'meh', as the maps aren't well designed for them or their stealthy manuevers. Aliens lack the alternate vision to utilize dark places and require to interact with vents rather than just being able to crawl inside them- very frustrating. Overall, the aliens in AVP 1 were waaay better across the board. Melee mechanics are also cheesefests, requiring a game of rock/paper/scissors. Block>Fast Attack>Strong Attack>Block. Doing the proper move throws the enemy off balance, opening a "special". The specials look amazing and will kill the target, but leaves you vulnerable whilst the animation goes on for 5+ seconds. (pretty much a suicide button while playing an alien, you will curse when doing it by accident) All in all, gripes aside, I was pleased with this short but fun game. Despite its failings, I had a lot of fun playing every race. The game is beautiful, fast paced, and should be in your library if you're a fan of the franchise. The weapons are all fun to use and the AI moves erratically enough that walls will crawl with dangerous fun. If an alien charges you head on, its because he's tanking for his 3 buddies behind/above/under you. I played several missions many times over, especially the later levels where more interesting enemies are encountered. If you need a great looking shooter to keep you busy for few sessions- this is worth the cost of admission.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 17, 2014
												AvP offers a blend of interesting gameplay, from the gun-toting hardass Marines, to the swift and brutal Xenomorphs, to the stealthy and tactical Predators.Marines: The marine campaign takes the Doom 3 route, and relies mostly on jumpscares to frighten you. Don't be fooled, because it does it well. It also knows when you've grown from the jumpscares, and turns itself into a proper FPS with enemies that are both easy and difficult to kill.Aliens: The alien campaign is also a good one. The running on ceilings and hiding in vents, while one by one eliminating every single enemy in the vicinity. Also, seeing civies running in fear is fun.Predators: The predator campaign, my personal favorite, is a blend of the two. You have both lethal melee and ranged weaponry at your disposal. But, the amount of times you can use these weapons are limited, forcing you to decide whether you should use your last four bars of energy to waste that marine and hope that you can recharge your reserves, or go up close and attempt to kill him that way.The only complaint is that Rebellion have spread themselves a bit too thin. There's only six stages for the Marines and Predators, while the Aliens have to make do with a measly five missions. If they would give us more in the form of DLC, i would be satisfied. But, seeing as this is a four-year old game, i doubt it'll happen.8/10

content:
Posted: July 26, 2012
												This game, co-produced/made by SEGA, is truly fun but kinda short. I finished the Predator campaign in just under 4 hours. The graphics are stellar...the details to the Predator, Aliens and Marines and there respective weaponry is awesome. Playing as a Predator is truly an experience. I do love this game, but I'm also a diehard fan of the DarkHorse comics...and for that reason I say make sure before you get it your a fan of the series. You can play as all 3 main races, each one different. And the voice acting is top-notch (Lance Henriksen aka Bishop is in it). Good game, but only for those that like/love the universe/movies.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 28, 2013
												For a game that promised much and delivered not-so-much, AvP remains a decent game based around a (formerly?) excellent franchise. With three full single-player campaigns detailing each of the three antagonistic species there is plenty of story to go around, with the stand-out example being the Aliens, and all of these campaigns have some interesting experiences to offer. Fans of the entire franchise, not just the films, will be thrilled by the many references to other Aliens media, such as the novels and the Colonial Marine Technical Manual. Multiplayer modes are a crap-shoot and co-op survival is so limited in scope as to be vestigial; play this one for the stories.

content:
Posted: September 14, 2013
												AVP sem hrál poprvé snad v 9ti letech - myslim to původní z roku 99 nebo kolik to bylo...jo k němu sem se dostal ůplně náhodou, nebylo to moc težký..stačilo napálit na kole přímo do zdi v rychlosti cca 25km/h..no a bylo avp, a držka nasračky :D ty krávo to byla šleha...ale v pohodě měl sem tmu asi 5min pak sem došel domu, naštěstí sem to měl vymyšlený a stalo se mi to cca 20metrů od domova..takže sem došel domu, udělal si kakao,poblil se a omdlel sem..pak si jen pamatuju že sem se probudil v nemocnici a byla tam semnou mamka..a taky že sem tam byl za krypla, protože si mamka myslela že me pustí domu a nic mi nevzala sebou tak sem tam byl den ve slipech jako největší krypl a úchyl z nemocnice..no nic... v hracím koutku byl počítač, kde bylo avpčko a už to bylo..pak mě pustili domů, šup do obchodu,bum,bum a hrál sem...tak to by bylo..tohle avp sem chtěl kvůli původní firmě, no po letech zase dobrá hra - avp,avp2 bylo o hodně lepší, ale tak co chtít..je to vlastně to samé akorát to vypadá k světu...hra mě bavila jako svině, mariňák už neni tak posrávací, ale pořád ztoho seru :D nahrál sem dost i multiplayeru...já se bavil jako král. 7.5/10

Posted: September 9, 2012
												This was quite good overall on the singleplayer front.  The only frustrating things at times were areas where objectives weren't clear enough or the game was bugged into having you fight waves of enemies that wouldn't ever end.  The alien controls were also a bit bad often becoming disorienting and at other times downright frustrating (inching back and forth below a vent to try to find the magic spot where the game would say "press X to enter the vent").Multiplayer is fairly empty from players, at least the few months ago when I last tried it, it's good fun with friends.It's good for one playthrough, I think it took me about 8 hours or so to finish singleplayer.  Get it on sale if you can.7/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 29, 2014
												As a single player fps it's mostly ok, considering the fact that all three of the characters' campaigns can be finished in one afternoon. That's at least consistent with the earlier avp games. The redeeming factor, however, was to be the multiplayer.  Now in the first two games, the multiplayer was awesome. That doesn't happen here. Here Are a few reasons why that is.-The characters are sluggish and stiff .-The quicktime kills are still present and spamable.-There is no visible ballance between the playable races .-The several maps present in the vanilla game are all absurdly boring and similar in design.-When playing the alien or predator the impact of your attacks is barely noticeable, meaning that you can't always tell if you're doing damage or not. -Even when your attacks connect with the enemy, your screen is constantly blurred by smudges of blood making gameplay severely disorienting in a bad way.-The gamemodes are standard and therefore unimaginative. -Survival mode is a slap in the face to anyone eager to experience the thrills of an Aliens movie, because you're stuck in a 5x5 room at all times. Did i mention it's an ugly little room?-Numerous exploitable glitches.-A barely existent community. Several dedicated servers with the same TDM, DM, MDM modes active. You're better off hosting your own. All in all, for the sake of the single player AND if you're a fan, get it on sale. And by "sale" i mean 5$ or less.

content:
Posted: January 2, 2012
												Play as the marines, aliens or predator in this updated version of the classic '99 AvP. The marines campaign offers the standard FPS game, you are given a motion sensor which will aid you in tracking where enemies are coming from. The Predator plays a bit more stealthily, you can cloak yourself to be invisible to humans but can still be tracked by aliens. Also your infrared can show you locations of the marines but not the aliens. You can distort and distract the marines to allow for easier takedowns. The aliens has no ranged attacks but they have the ability to move about freely anywhere on the map. You can climb walls and ceiliings get places you wouldn't even think of. Might be hard to find some online multiplayer games, but the campaigns themselves are well worth it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 9, 2011
About The Game:Aliens vs Predator (2010) is developed by Rebellion & Published by Sega. It's a re-design of the older versions of the game.Aliens vs Predator (2010) is one of the final installments to the AvP franchise & it's also my favourite installment of the series, it's not perfect but it holds a place in my heart that couldn't be filled by the other titles.The Review:Aliens vs Predator is one of the most inovative & unique games around due to it's ability to throw 3 different class types & still manage to keep it "somewhat" balanced & exciting, this game plays very nice and feels like an Aliens vs Predator experience that it should be.Races Overview:Marine: The Marine is a humanoid race that is very weak & uses human created weapons, these weapons consist of all the weapons found in the movies & games previous to this game.The Marine is weak against both Races at close quarters or at a range, but the Marine does get a deadly arsenal of weaponry that make him a fearsom opponent to any who decise to tackle him head first.The Marine is stronger against the Aliens than the Predators but that's only because Aliens have to sneak up on him to get a clean kill & with the Marines motion tracker they're easily spotted & dispatched unless the Marine has slow witts.Predator: The Predator is an Alienoid race that's closer related to humans than to an animal, he's smart & agile, he's also very cunning & has a very large arsonel of deadly weaponary at his grasp which can destroy all opponents if they're not on the look out or quickly witted.The Predator relies in his Cloaking Device & his Mask Vision in order to track & stalk his prey but that doesn't mean that he can't defend himself, his weaponary consists of his famous Wrist Blades for close quarter combat against opponents dumb enough to get close to this monster.For those opponents at a distance thinking they can out shoot him, a devestating aray of hightech Alien weaponary,  The Combi Stick which can be stealthly used to toss at targets.  Disk Blades that will slice through any opponents skin & decapitate anyone who might be in the thick of it's way Plasma Caster that locks onto 1 target and barely misses, if it does miss then 9 times out of 10 you'll be knocked over & vulnerable to him for a few seconds.Predator is weak to Marines mostly because of his ability to track you whilst you're on the roam & the motion sensor that can pick you up at close range even if you're cloaked, as Predator relies on what he sees he is a good target for Snipers at a long distance to pick off rather than tackling him head first.Alien is a Alienoid race that is more closely related to Animals,  it has a humanoid body but it also has a tail with a long sharp blade on the end & it runs around on four legs, it also cannot talk making weird high pitched hisses like a snake does.Aliens are deadly when it comes to Stealth as they are dark black & can hide in the shadows, climbe on walls & hang from roofs with ease & if you think that is bad they're even worse in groups because of their speed & agility.Aliens rely on their ability to track scents through walls & floors so they can see you coming before you even know they are there, but because of their great sense of smell they are also at a disadvantage from any targets who are at a distance.Because Alien uses all fours to move around they cannot use weapons, so they are constantly at risk from targets who are hiding or shooting from a distance, Alien requires to be close in order to attack it's targets & so they're more deadly to a Marine than to a Predator but they're also more suceptible to the Marine due to his Motion tracker which means they need to rely on their ability to hide in shadows & wall climbing to get the drop on the Marine.The Alien's weaponary consists of it's long tail with the blade on the end, it's sharp claws that rip at your flesh & it's second mouth that's inside it's primary mouth in order to gouge out vital organs or eyes.Campaign Review:Aliens vs Predator (2010) features 3 seperate race Campaigns which are roughly 4 hours long and each connect somewhere along the lines ingame.It's unfortunate that all the levels are just redesigned for each class to make it feel different but it still all looks the same and is very farmiliar after the first playthrough, but this does not make it a great campaign to play through once in a while just because the gameplay is great.The 3 Campaigns you can play feature each race type: Marine. (Hardest Campaign & longest, that probably spans out to about 6+ hours, depending on difficulty level chosen)  Predator. (Shortest Campaign & easiest but it's still fun and can be completed in around 2 hours even on the hardest difficulty setting) Alien. (Moderately long campaign but EXTREMELY fun and my most favourite of all, this campaign takes around 3 - 4 hours to complete on the hardest difficulty setting).Each campaign is unique in experience because of the race you play, they might feature the same maps & area's but they're differently played with each race as you follow new paths to complete the objectives.The Campaign spans out over several different area's but unfortunately these area's are very lineir & get repetative getting from point A - Point B constantly.Campaign Rating:The Campaign gets a 5/10 rating because of a few factors:Campaign is fun for a few plays but gets boring pretty quickly.Due to the Campaign being quite long if you play all races it deserves praise but it also has a vast amount of flaws. Campaign lacks much story & that's a down point as well, Campaign really is just to familiaries yourself with the controls in order to play Multiplayer.The AI isn't all that smart & thus campaign is a breeze on the easier difficulties until you play Hard or Nightmare and even then it's mainly the bosses that kill you.Multiplayer Review:Now we get to the part of the game that makes the whole experience worth while & the whole game worth the purchase price.In Multiplayer there are a few different gamemodes: Deathmatch Species Team Deathmatch Mixed Species Team Deathmatch Predator Hunt Infestation SurvivorDeathmatch & Species Team Deathmatch are just as they sound.Mixed Species Team Deathmatch is just Team Deathmatch but instead of Predators vs Aliens & Marines you can have different species on your team fighting to be the best & win.Predator Hunt is a fun gamemode that is kind of like a Team game but it's also a FFA, the Marine team has to hunt down & kill the lone Predator who stalks them. In order to score points in Predator Hunt you need to be the Predator and kill Marines to get points & thus the person who is Predator the longest and kills the most people wins.Infestation is a game all about elimination much like Predator Hunt, except instead of Predators it's Aliens & instead of winning by kills you win by being the last Marine left after the team is wiped out, the idea of Infestation is for the Aliens to kill the Marines & the Marines need to stay alive as long as possible to become the last man standing.Survivor is much what it sounds like.The Multiplayer as it always has been in each AvP game is 100% amazing, and it's sad to say that it's quite underpopulated due to the lack of updates this game requires to make it to the point of playablely sound.Currently there is a number of bugs that make this game a chore to play online against other people with, High Ping & Stealth/Trophy Kill spammers make this game a nightmare because getting a kill is a breeze when these 2 factors come in.Multiplayer Rating:Multiplayer Recieves a solid 7/10.Do I Recommend This Game?: YESNo space to review.

Very few servers actually have these maps in rotation, and the single player campaign does not appear to use them at all.

content:
Posted: March 30, 2015
												Alien vs. Predator is one of the franchises games that keeps the essance of the films and transitions it extrodinarly well to the game you will play. Story Line : You have 3 story mode arc's giving you the perspective of the three different races in the Alien and Predator Universe. : Alien.: Predator.: Human.All the races have advantages and disadvantages to use in the Story Mode and Online play. Alien vs. Predator is an old game now although this does not take anything away from it itself. Negatives:  there is a very hard learning curve for online play to newcomers. : Old graphics.Positives Very immersive online experience, you really feel like you are the race that you play with.Great storyline for all 3 different races that all merge together no matter what race you may pick. Still a very active online community. Has full Pc controller support. Ending result : Alien vs. Predator is a satisfying twisth on the Alien and Predator universe brought to pc gaming. I would recommend this game to any of my friends rating it a solid 7.5.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 28, 2015
												It contains three rather short but enjoyable campaigns. I especially liked playing as marine, as you really get the feeling that you are totally alone out there to survive, so the horror works in this game as it's not (just) cheap jumpscare. Using predator skills is satisfying and they feel powerful enough. There is enough challenge if you play on Hard, there is enough variation on boss fights, so you don't get bored. Then about the multiplayer. There still are some people playing it, but usually you have to wait around 15 min before getting the game started.Visually it still looks great and you clearly can see that they made some extra work and optimizing for PC port so it looks and runs good. It feels like they didn't use much time for optimizing keyboard+mouse controls, although playing with 360 gamepad is smooth and fun experience which I rarely can say about FPS-games when played with gamepad. The game takes around 11 hours to complete, so with the current price (3,75€) it's really worth it!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												AvP 2010 really lets you feel like you're a Xenomorph or a Predator. The story is throwaway, but decently executed. The graphics still hold up well, along with the sound. The gameplay is phenomenal: fun (and tough) AI, solid feeling abilities, excellent animations, good level design. All the little touches (acid/blood on the Predator's blades) and great sound effects make the game pretty immersive. What's not so great? The Marine campaign is noticeably weaker than either the Xenomorph or Predator, with goofy voice acting and limited scare value. Max graphics still require a decently powerful videocard to pull off (especially the DX11 effects) at high res (1080p+) at 60fps. Almost no one plays multiplayer anymore.Don't pick this game up expecting amazing writing. This game excels at giving you a sweet Alien/Predator experience, and an okay Marine one. If you are at all an Alien/Predator fan, definitely worth picking this up.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 24, 2014
												Meh.. It's alright. There are 3 different play types/styles. Marine, Predator & Alien.Shooting mechanics for the marine aren't great if I'm being honest, there's no aiming down the sight feature so it's kinda like CS, just hover the crosshair over the target, press the button & pray it hits. The marine story though is probably the best though, roaming about with Aliens, Predators, Androids (Yes, androids) & of course facehuggers is very cool with the lighting design of some of the areas of the maps.The Aliens I didn't really like so much, the camera angles when you are on ceilings & walls was kinda irritating because it doesn't let you look everywhere, it limits you to what the creators believe would be the Xenomorph's turning circle would be with it's head. But it does put you in the eyes of the Xenomorph which is cool when you are upside down. Some of the execution animations are cool as well.Onto the Predator, decent enough to play with & you do kinda have to approach each situation with stealth. Various gadgets & visions are cool as well. Biggest problem I have with the Predator is that it feels a little underpowered if anything. Again some of the executions are pretty sweet.Overall gameplay wise from every character not the greatest, story isn't massively deep either.. but if you like Aliens, Predators or creepy shooters, it's worth buying in a Steam sale.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 28, 2014
												Being a fan of the origina AvP i had high expectations for this title, sadly it doesn't live up to it predecesor. Which doesn't mean its a bad game necesarily, its just not as polished as its namesake.Starting with the controls, which range from well implemented and fun (Predator) to laughably mediocre (Marine) the game feel like it was built on a deadline and i believe some aspects of gameplay could and have been executed better specificaly the "cutsceens" for doing simple tasks tend to get anoying at times and tend to cut the flow of the game instead of enhancing it. The story does a good job of keeping us interested in the charachters as well as building continuity between the three campaigns and creating that distinct AvP atmosphere that are the backbone of these games. The graphics are top notch although the level design could have been done a littl e better in my opinion, Some of the levels feel like they just threw you into a sandbox with a few trees and buildings for ambiance and though this kind of level design works in multiplayer (wich i believe was a higher priority for the designers) it feel a little artificial on single player. Overall its a good game but not a great one. so if you are a fan of the franchise or happen to catch it on sale on steam I would definetly recomend this title. For everyone else i would probably wait till it goes down in price a bit before buying it.

Graphically looks great for its age(lighting and rendering and effects are superb), controls can feel a bit clunky when transitioning from ground > wall  > ceiling but one cant really say how it should work anyway. Moot point. Sound bites that the marines use when they detect you are a bit repetative, the detection of the alien by the marines is also somewhat poor- even on hard.  Still, going back to some positive points:I still love the way the alien can zoom around and perform brutal attacks, theres the right level of intruigue and adventure given the simplicity of the rooms. Enough of the original folklore from each of the respective genres has made it into the game giving it a authentic feel for those alien/predator fans.  Overall its managed to steal about 5 hours from this weekend so would definately recommend giving it a blast. 7/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
AvP 2010 isn't horribly bad -it's certainly no Colonial Marines- but it's still boringly mediocre.The game looks good both technically and aesthetically but the levels are linear, feel small and and despite vertical movement abilities for the Xenomorph and Predator, the action still happens mostly on level ground. The gameplay is repetitive, fails to put you in any interesting situations and on top of that the game is short and recycles almost all of its levels for the different races. At the very least the human campaign has you actually fighting the xenos more often than other humans/androids this time around.The combat can become formulaic, almost flowchart like, especially for the Xeno and Predator who rely on melee combat and constant lengthy takedown animations. The weapons apart from the sniper rifle stay true to AvP canon but in doing so are few and uninspired.The story doesn't even try to bring anything new to the table and all the races lack any clear goal or motivation beyond "move to the next area and kill everything that moves".Again, it's not really broken in any way but I still can't recommend it to even the hardest of Aliens versus Predator fans.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2014
												Overall. from the marine side of things (which is the only campaign i like playing in the AVP series), a pretty solid piece of entertainment. It has great graphics, great atmosphere, some good scares and the best alien AI in any Alien franchise game.-They're literally "Comin' outta the walls", especially in the sequences in the hive.  Another aspect of the game that Ithink Rebellion hit right square on the head is the lack of ammo throughout the game, which at some points leads to resorting to using the pistol. The only drawbacks to the game, in my opinion, is a rather lame jump that leads climbing to up on objects and a lack of a crouch button. The climbing wastes precious time during battles and not being able to crouch leads to getting unnecessarily shot when you could duck behind objects during said battles.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												This game did a HORRIBLE job at portraying Xenomorphs. The Alien movies made it clear Xenomorphs are supposed to be very strong, they were able to bend steel doors and rip people to pieces without using tools, but in this game, Xenomorphs were DRASTICALLY NERFED. As a marine, you kill Xenomorphs so easily and I couldn't stand how the Xenomorphs moved in this game. The Xenomorphs were running by using their arms, wtf? Xenomorphs don't move like that. The Xenomorphs in this game came from humans, why were they running on fours? They looked silly. You got to love how the Xenomorphs' blood does not affect ANYONE. When you kill a Xenomorph, its blood doesn't hurt you at all. WTF! The Alien movies have shown Xenomorphs' blood melting multiple floors. You can't even spit acid at people as a Xenomorph. Xenomorphs were able to spit acid in Alien 3 and Alien Resurrection. And when did Predators become so strong? As a Predator, you can break a Xenomorph's back by using your knee... WTF! Predators are not that strong. Danny Glover and Adrien Brody killed Predators in HAND TO HAND COMBAT in the movies! And you can kill Xenomorphs simply by stabbing them with blades. Xenomorphs are supposed to have EXOSKELETONS, colonial marines in the movie Aliens needed 10mm caseless armour piercing rounds to penetrate the Xenomorphs' exoskeletons. But hey, guess what? In this game, Predators can kill Xenomorphs just by stabbing them. Are you kidding me! HUMANS can kill Predators in HAND TO HAND COMBAT, it was shown multiple times in the Predator movies. Why do you think writers always make Predators fight humans in hand to hand combat in every Predator movie? Because Predators aren't that much stronger than humans. If Predators were super strong like Xenomorphs then a physical combat between a human and a Predator would be pointless, but no, Predators got killed by a cop and a pianist in hand to hand combat. It's so obvious the developers of this stupid game DRASTICALLY NERFED the Aliens to make the fights fair for the Predators. I seriously will NEVER understand why people prefer that ridiculous crab faced monkey with dreadlocks over the Xenomorph. Realistically, a Xenomorph would make short work out of any Predator. Thank God the AvP media isn't canon because of Ridley Scott's Alien prequels. Anyone who prefers Predator over Alien is an idiot with no taste. The ONLY reason why Predators are this popular is because of their crossover with the Aliens. Without this stupid crossover, most people wouldn't know who Predators are.

												Without sounding like a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t infommercial I just want to say that this game is the absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥ It is AWESOME!! You have the equivalent of three full games, (The Marines, The Predators & The Aliens) but they mesh seamlessly together into a storyline that is sure to please any fan of the Aliens or The Predators series. It has a healthy amount of FPS but the Predator and the Alien aspect of it gives you completely new elements and gameplay methods like the Predators Mega Jump and the Aliens Wall Crawl so youll get heaps more time of play out of it even after you finish the game, as its always fun to go back and explore those areas that gave you grief, and try out the new moves you have by now mastered. 												I recommend this game if it is below $15.. That being said, belows lists some qualities of the game.Graphics are pretty good actually and atmosphere isn't bad. Different visions are fun to play with..you have 3 campaigns  just like the originals, though I must say that they each feel a tad short. They were pretty good though. (though the Alien campaign is the Predator campaign played backwards. the Marine campaign  actually shows more variation, but they all link up here and there)  Marine campaign has a few spook moments from both aliens and predators.The gameplay is fun. and the performance is dynamic, sometimes on some systems it is very good, on others it is meh... (and you have to reduce some settings)The multiplayer is still alive, though I must say playing as a predator online is kinda dissapointing because people like to camp the predators weapon spawnpoints.If you are wanting a different FPS to play and can find it for under $15 I would say this would be a good buy.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2010
												The idea of multiple campaigns one for each species is a great idea and single player was pretty fun. Multiplayer is also an interesting experience pitting each of the species against each other. However this games control system feels very cluncky at times and manuvering around the maps especially with aliens can be very disorientating. Multiplayer is also plagued by people relying upon the overpowered predators who easily over power the less advanced human and alien species. There is also the issue of executions i this game by sneaking up behind an enemy you can perform an execution which is an instan kill, but the catch is an execution performs a 3 second cinematic giving enemies plenty of time to kill you or walk behind you and perform an execution.

												I liked this game.  Took about 12 hours to play through all 3 campaigns.  You play as human, alien & predator and use their various skills.  The story was interesting but the best parts were the pulse rifle (best sci-fi gun sound effect), the alien's finish kill and the predator's jumping.  I thought this was better than the metacritic score and worth the price I paid (on sale).  Although it looks like there isn't any multi-player community left.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												Is AvP the best game ever made? No. Is it a fun addition to the franchise? Yes. Is it expensive? Nope. Just don't buy the DLC packs — together they cost almost as much as the full game, and with no one on multiplayer there's no way you'll get your money's worth.Anyway, as a fan of the franchises involved, I had a lot of fun with the game. Each campaign is relatively short with only six missions, but it's almost like getting three episodic games. The way the events of each campaign are interconnected is really cool, and while each one tells a story on its own, they come together to make something bigger, and surprisingly leave room for what could be a really good sequel.Full review here: http://postlaunch.blogspot.ca/2012/03/aliens-vs-predator.html

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												AVP isnt horrible. Now as a big fan of the AVP world and so on, I will say it is a bit dissapointing. However if you are a die hard fan and I see now where it's only 14,99 US, i reccomend it if you got the time. The Predator campaign is really whats fun about the game. the effects were impressive at moments in the game, and were very poor also. Now the Alien campaign isnt too bad either but I found it being a headache most of the time and annoying at parts. The human campaign lacked really in most areas of gameplay and effects. Like I said the Predator campaign is actually fun for the most part but yet it has lacking and unimpressive portions as well. I'm not going to reveal to much about the game for spoiler alert reasons but im sure by now mosy have seen at the very least gameplay of it all so it doesent matter i supose but the point im making is if your thinking about obtaining the game then know that the campaign is not excessively long at all and the multiplayer was never really good and no one plays it anyways anymore. If your a fan then you will enjoy moments of it and cherish it in your own way but yes this game lacks in many areas and could have been done much better if you ask me. however for the price you hopefully wont regret it. 6.5/10
